title: Northumberland
summary: Northumberland (/nɔːrˈθʌmbərlənd/[2]) is a historic county and unitary authority in North East England. The latter has a headquarters at Morpeth and borders east Cumbria, north County Durham and north Tyne and Wear. The historic county town is Alnwick.[3] It and the historic county of Durham are traditionally known together as Northumbria.
